00060 #define COMMAND_RETURN_LENGTH   1024
00061 
00065 #define COMMAND_ARGS_LENGTH             256
00066 
00070 #define SOCKET_BACKLOG                  4
00071 
00075 #define SOCKET_PERMISSIONS              (S_IXGRP | S_IXOTH)
00076 
00080 #define SOCKET_CLOSED                   (-1)
00081 
00085 #define NO_PROTOCOL                             0
00086 
00090 static pthread_t listen_thread;
00091 
00095 static int socket_descriptor = SOCKET_CLOSED;
00096 
00103 static void *listen_socket(void *arg);

00136 int kurud_console_init() {
00137         int len;
00138         int old_mask;
00139         int bind_return;
00140         struct sockaddr_un local;
00141         int code;
00142 
00143         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00144 
00145         /* Create socket file. */
00146         TRY((socket_descriptor = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, NO_PROTOCOL)) != -1,
00147                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_CREATE, strerror(errno)));
00148 
00149         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON, "name of console socket: %s.",
00150                         kurud_get_console_file);
00151 
00152         /* sockaddr_un structure setup. */
00153         local.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00154         len = strlen(kurud_get_console_file());
00155         ASSERT(len < sizeof(local.sun_path), ERR(REASON_SOCKET_TOO_LONG));
00156         strncpy(local.sun_path, kurud_get_console_file(), len);
00157 
00158         /* Delete UDS file if it exists. */
00159         TRY(unlink(local.sun_path) != -1, ERROR(REASON_UNLINK, strerror(errno)));
00160 
00161         len = sizeof(local);
00162 
00163         /* Bind the UDS. */
00164         old_mask = umask(SOCKET_PERMISSIONS);
00165         bind_return = bind(socket_descriptor, (struct sockaddr *)&local, len);
00166         umask(old_mask);
00167 
00168         /* Check bind return. */
00169         ASSERT(bind_return != -1,
00170                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_BIND, kurud_get_console_file()));
00171 
00172         /* Start listening at the socket. */
00173         TRY(listen(socket_descriptor, SOCKET_BACKLOG) != -1,
00174                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_LISTEN, strerror(errno)));
00175 
00176         /* Thread to listen packets. */
00177         TRY(pthread_create(&listen_thread, NULL, listen_socket,
00178                                         (void *)socket_descriptor) == 0,
00179                         ERROR(REASON_THREAD_CREATE, strerror(errno)));
00180 
00181         code = KURUD_OK;
00182 
00183         liblog_info(MODULE_DAEMON, "kurud console initialized.");
00184 
00185 end:
00186         return code;
00187 }
00188 
00189 int kurud_console_wait() {
00190         int code;
00191 
00192         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00193         TRY(pthread_join(listen_thread, NULL) == 0,
00194                         ERROR(REASON_THREAD_RUN, strerror(errno)));
00195 
00196         code = KURUD_OK;
00197 end:
00198         return code;
00199 
00200 }
00201 
00202 int kurud_console_finish() {
00203         int code;
00204 
00205         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00206 
00207         /* Close and delete socket file if it exists. */
00208         if (socket_descriptor != SOCKET_CLOSED) {
00209                 TRY(unlink(kurud_get_console_file()) != -1,
00210                                 ERROR(REASON_UNLINK, strerror(errno)));
00211                 TRY(close(socket_descriptor) != -1,
00212                                 ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_CLOSE, strerror(errno)));
00213         }
00214         TRY(pthread_cancel(listen_thread) == 0,
00215                         ERROR(REASON_THREAD_CANCEL, strerror(errno)));
00216 
00217         code = KURUD_OK;
00218 end:
00219         liblog_info(MODULE_DAEMON, "kurud console finalized.");
00220         return code;
00221 }

00223 /*============================================================================*/
00224 /* Private functions implementations.                                         */
00225 /*============================================================================*/
00226 
00227 static void *listen_socket(void *arg) {
00228         socklen_t socklen; /* sockaddr size */
00229         int client; /* socket accepted at UDS */
00230         pthread_t child; /* thread processing socket */
00231         struct sockaddr remote; /* sockaddr structure for client socket */
00232         int code;
00233 
00234         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00235 
00236         while (1) {
00237 
00238                 /* Obtain the client socket.. */
00239                 socklen = sizeof(remote);
00240                 client = accept(socket_descriptor, (struct sockaddr *)&remote,
00241                                 &socklen);
00242                 ASSERT(client != -1, ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_ACCEPT, strerror(errno)));
00243 
00244                 /* Create thread for processing that socket. */
00245                 TRY(pthread_create(&child, NULL, handle_connection, (void *)client),
00246                                 ERROR(REASON_THREAD_CREATE, strerror(errno)));
00247                 continue;
00248         }
00249 end:
00250         if (code == KURUD_ERROR)
00251                 close(client);
00252         return NULL;
00253 }
00254 
00255 void *handle_connection(void *arg) {
00256         int n; /* used to store recv fuction return */
00257         int layer; /* id of the layer requested */
00258         int command; /* the id of the command requested */
00259         int client; /* socket of the accepted client */
00260 
00261         /* Receive from *arg param the client socket descriptor */
00262         client = (int)arg;
00263 
00264         /*
00265          * The format of the expected packet is:
00266          * 
00267          * [int layer_id]       : id of the layer
00268          * [int command_id]     : id of the command to be requested
00269          * [cont..]
00270          * 
00271          * If command_id == KURUD_COMMAND_LIST_REQUEST, 
00272          *      then packet is requesting command list and [cont..] is empty;
00273          *      else [cont..] is the argument list:
00274          * [u_char command_args_len]        : size in bytes of the command_args
00275          * [command_args[command_args_len]] : command_args string 
00276          * 
00277          * The packet sent in response to KURUD_COMMAND_LIST_REQUEST is
00278          * [int command_size]               : size of the command_console_t array
00279          * [command_console_t *commands]    : the command_console_t array
00280          * 
00281          * If command is any executable command, the response packet is:
00282          * [int out_len] : size of the output
00283          * [char *output]: the output for the command.
00284          */
00285 
00286         /* Receive layer_id */
00287 
00288         n = recv(client, &layer, sizeof(layer), 0);
00289         ASSERT(n != -1, ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE, strerror(errno)));
00290         ASSERT(n >= sizeof(layer), ERR(REASON_COMMAND_PARSING));
00291 
00292         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON,
00293                         "console request: layer_id=%d:%s.", layer,
00294                         (layer == LAYER_LINK) ? "(LAYER_LINK)" :
00295                         (layer == LAYER_NET) ? "(LAYER_NET)" :
00296                         (layer == LAYER_RELIABLE) ? "(LAYER_RELIABLE)" :
00297                         (layer == LAYER_UNRELIABLE) ? "(LAYER_UNRELIABLE)" :
00298                         "(UNKNOWN LAYER)");
00299 
00300         ASSERT(layer >= LAYER_LINK && layer <= LAYER_UNRELIABLE,
00301                         ERROR(REASON_LAYER_INVALID, layer));
00302 
00303         /* Receive command_id */
00304         n = recv(client, &command, sizeof(command), 0);
00305         ASSERT(n != -1, ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE, strerror(errno)));
00306         ASSERT(n >= sizeof(command), ERR(REASON_COMMAND_PARSING));
00307 
00308         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON, "console request: comand=%d.", command);
00309 
00310         if (command == KURUD_COMMAND_LIST_REQUEST) {
00311                 /* Layer command list requested. */
00312                 TRY(handle_command_list_request(client, layer),
00313                                 ERR(REASON_COMMAND_EXEC));
00314         } else {
00315                 /* Layer command execution requested. */
00316                 TRY(handle_execution_request(client, layer, command),
00317                                 ERR(REASON_COMMAND_EXEC));;
00318         }
00319 
00320 end:
00321         close(client);
00322         return NULL;
00323 }
00324 
00325 int handle_command_list_request(int client, int layer) {
00326         command_console_t *commands;
00327         int size;
00328         char ack;
00329         int code;
00330 
00331         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00332 
00333         /* TODO descomentar os cases comentados quando eles estiverem 
00334          * implementados. */
00335         size = 0;
00336         switch (layer) {
00337                 case LAYER_LINK:
00338                         kurud_link_console->console_get_commands(&commands, &size);
00339                         break;
00340                 case LAYER_NET:
00341                         kurud_net_console->console_get_commands(&commands, &size);
00342                         break;
00343                         /*case LAYER_RELIABLE:
00344                          * freedomd_layer_reliable_console->console_get_command_list(
00345                          * &console_commands, &commands_size);
00346                          * break;
00347                          * case LAYER_UNRELIABLE:
00348                          * freedomd_layer_unreliable_console->console_get_command_list(
00349                          * &console_commands, &commands_size); */
00350                 default:
00351                         ERROR(REASON_LAYER_INVALID, layer);
00352                         break;
00353         }
00354 
00355         /* Send the size of commands structure. */
00356         TRY(send(client, &size, sizeof(size), 0) != -1,
00357                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_SEND, strerror(errno)));
00358 
00359         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON,
00360                         "console request: command_list returned (commands:%d).",
00361                         size / sizeof(command_console_t));
00362 
00363         /* Sends console_commands structure if there is commands to send. */
00364         if (size > 0) {
00365                 TRY(send(client, commands, size, 0) != -1,
00366                                 ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_SEND, strerror(errno)));
00367         }
00368 
00369         /* Terminate processing socket. */
00370         TRY(recv(client, &ack, sizeof(ack), 0), ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE,
00371                                         strerror(errno)));
00372         code = KURUD_OK;
00373 end:
00374         close(client);
00375         return code;
00376 }
00377 
00378 int handle_execution_request(int client, int layer, int command) {
00379         int n;
00380         unsigned char args_len;
00381         char args[COMMAND_ARGS_LENGTH];
00382         char msg[COMMAND_RETURN_LENGTH];
00383         int msg_len;
00384         char ack;
00385         int code;
00386 
00387         code = KURUD_ERROR;
00388 
00389         /* Receive command args length in bytes. */
00390         n = recv(client, &args_len, sizeof(args_len), 0);
00391         ASSERT(n != -1, ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE, strerror(errno)));
00392         ASSERT(n >= sizeof(args_len), ERR(REASON_COMMAND_PARSING));
00393 
00394         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON,
00395                         "console request: command_args_len=%d.", args_len);
00396 
00397         /* Receive command_args. */
00398         n = recv(client, args, args_len, 0);
00399         ASSERT(n != -1, ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE, strerror(errno)));
00400         ASSERT(n == args_len && n < COMMAND_ARGS_LENGTH,
00401                         ERR(REASON_COMMAND_PARSING));
00402 
00403         liblog_debug(MODULE_DAEMON,
00404                         "console request: command_args=%s.", args);
00405 
00406         /* TODO descomentar os cases comentados quando eles estiverem 
00407          * implementados. */
00408 
00409         /* Execute command. */
00410         args[n] = '\0';
00411         msg[0] = '\0';
00412         switch (layer) {
00413                 case LAYER_LINK:
00414                         TRY(kurud_link_console->console_execute(msg, COMMAND_RETURN_LENGTH,
00415                                                         command, args), ERR(REASON_COMMAND_EXEC));
00416                         break;
00417                 case LAYER_NET:
00418                         TRY(kurud_net_console->console_execute(msg, COMMAND_RETURN_LENGTH,
00419                                                         command, args), ERR(REASON_COMMAND_EXEC));
00420                         break;
00421                         /*case LAYER_RELIABLE:
00422                          * freedomd_layer_reliable_console->console_execute_command(
00423                          * msg, COMMAND_RETURN_MESSAGE_MAX_LEN,
00424                          * command_id, command_args);
00425                          * break;
00426                          * case LAYER_UNRELIABLE:
00427                          * freedomd_layer_unreliable_console->console_execute_command(
00428                          * msg, COMMAND_RETURN_MESSAGE_MAX_LEN,
00429                          * command_id, command_args);
00430                          * break; */
00431                 default:
00432                         ERROR(REASON_LAYER_INVALID, layer);
00433                         break;
00434         }
00435 
00436         /* Send the size of returned message. */
00437         msg_len = strlen(msg);
00438         TRY(send(client, &msg_len, sizeof(msg_len), 0) != -1,
00439                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_SEND, strerror(errno)));
00440 
00441         /* Send returned message. */
00442         if (msg_len > 0) {
00443                 TRY(send(client, msg, msg_len, 0) != -1,
00444                                 ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_SEND, strerror(errno)));
00445         }
00446 
00447         TRY(recv(client, &ack, sizeof(ack), 0) != -1,
00448                         ERROR(REASON_SOCKET_RECEIVE, strerror(errno)));
00449 
00450         code = KURUD_OK;
00451 end:
00452         close(client);
00453         return code;
00454 }
